examples.advanced: 요즘 건강이 좋아서 기분도 좋아요.
examples.master: 좋은 사람을 만나면 인생이 풍요로워져요.

en.explanation: Pleasing. Excellent. Comfortable.

examples.advanced: My health is good these days, so I feel good too.
examples.master: If you meet good people, life becomes richer.

examples.advanced: 나쁜 습관을 고치는 것이 쉽지 않아요.
examples.master: 나쁜 일도 결국 좋은 일로 바뀔 수 있어요.

en.explanation: Not good. Harmful. Wrong.

examples.advanced: It's not easy to fix bad habits.
examples.master: Bad things can eventually turn into good things.

ko.explanation: 크기가 일반적인 것보다 위이다. 소리가 높다.

examples.advanced: 꿈을 크게 가지면 이룰 수 있어요.
examples.master: 작은 노력이 모여 큰 성공을 만들어요.

en.explanation: Size is above average. Sound is high.

examples.advanced: If you dream big, you can achieve it.
examples.master: Small efforts gather to create big success.

examples.advanced: 작은 것에서 행복을 찾을 수 있어요.
examples.master: 작은 친절이 큰 변화를 만들 수 있어요.

en.explanation: Size is below average.

examples.advanced: You can find happiness in small things.
examples.master: Small kindnesses can create big changes.

examples.advanced: 경험이 많으면 문제 해결이 쉬워요.
examples.master: 많이 가진 사람이 아니라 많이 나누는 사람이 행복해요.

en.explanation: Quantity or degree is large.

examples.intermediate: I'm busy because I have a lot of work.
examples.advanced: If you have a lot of experience, problem-solving becomes easier.
examples.master: It's not those who have much who are happy, but those who share much.

examples.advanced: 인원이 적으면 더 친해질 수 있어요.
examples.master: 적게 가지고도 풍요롭게 살 수 있어요.

en.explanation: Quantity or degree is small.

examples.intermediate: I couldn't go because time was short.
examples.advanced: If there are fewer people, you can become closer.
examples.master: You can live richly even with little.

ko.explanation: 한쪽 끝에서 다른 쪽 끝까지의 거리가 멀다.

examples.advanced: 인생은 길고 기회는 많아요.
examples.master: 긴 시간이 지나면 모든 것이 추억이 돼요.

en.explanation: The distance from one end to the other is far.

examples.intermediate: I waited a long time because the line was long.
examples.advanced: Life is long and opportunities are many.
examples.master: After a long time, everything becomes a memory.

ko.explanation: 한쪽 끝에서 다른 쪽 끝까지의 거리가 가깝다.

examples.advanced: 짧은 문장이 이해하기 쉬워요.
examples.master: 인생은 짧으니까 하고 싶은 일을 하세요.

en.explanation: The distance from one end to the other is close.

examples.intermediate: It's a shame because time is short.
examples.advanced: Short sentences are easy to understand.
examples.master: Life is short, so do what you want to do.

ko.explanation: 아래에서 위까지의 거리가 멀다. 수준이나 정도가 위이다.

examples.advanced: 목표를 높게 세우면 더 많이 성장해요.
examples.master: 높은 곳에 오르면 넓은 세상이 보여요.

en.explanation: The distance from bottom to top is far. Level or degree is high.

examples.intermediate: The building is so tall that it's scary.
examples.advanced: If you set high goals, you grow more.
examples.master: When you climb high, you see a wider world.

ko.explanation: 아래에서 위까지의 거리가 가깝다. 수준이나 정도가 아래이다.

examples.advanced: 낮은 자세로 배우면 빨리 성장해요.
examples.master: 겸손하게 자세를 낮추면 더 많이 배울 수 있어요.

en.explanation: The distance from bottom to top is close. Level or degree is low.

examples.advanced: If you learn with a humble attitude, you grow fast.
examples.master: If you humbly lower yourself, you can learn more.

examples.advanced: 한국어 실력이 빠르게 늘고 있어요.
examples.master: 빠른 결정이 항상 좋은 것은 아니에요.

en.explanation: Speed is high. Takes little time.

examples.advanced: My Korean skills are improving quickly.
examples.master: Fast decisions are not always good ones.

examples.advanced: 천천히 느리게 사는 것도 좋아요.
examples.master: 느려도 꾸준히 하면 결국 성공해요.

en.explanation: Speed is low. Takes a lot of time.

examples.advanced: It's also good to live slowly.
examples.master: Even if you're slow, if you're consistent, you'll eventually succeed.

examples.advanced: 책임감이 무겁게 느껴져요.
examples.master: 마음이 무거울 때는 이야기를 나누면 좋아요.

en.explanation: Weight is high.

examples.advanced: The responsibility feels heavy.
examples.master: When your heart feels heavy, it's good to talk about it.

examples.advanced: 가벼운 산책으로 기분 전환을 해요.
examples.master: 가벼운 농담이 분위기를 좋게 만들어요.

en.explanation: Weight is low.

examples.advanced: I change my mood with a light walk.
examples.master: Light jokes make the atmosphere better.

examples.advanced: 예쁜 마음을 가진 사람이 진짜 예쁜 사람이에요.
examples.master: 나이가 들어도 예쁘게 늙고 싶어요.

en.explanation: Beautiful to look at. Cute.

examples.advanced: A person with a pretty heart is truly pretty.
examples.master: Even as I age, I want to grow old beautifully.

examples.advanced: 잘생긴 것보다 성격이 좋은 게 더 중요해요.
examples.master: 잘생긴 외모보다 매력 있는 성격이 오래가요.

en.explanation: A man's appearance is good.

examples.advanced: Having a good personality is more important than being handsome.
examples.master: An attractive personality lasts longer than a handsome face.

examples.advanced: 뜨거운 열정으로 일하면 성공해요.
examples.master: 뜨거운 관심과 사랑이 관계를 유지해요.

en.explanation: Temperature is very high.

examples.advanced: If you work with hot passion, you succeed.
examples.master: Hot interest and love maintain relationships.

examples.advanced: 차가운 태도는 사람을 멀어지게 해요.
examples.master: 처음에는 차가워 보였지만 알고 보니 따뜻한 사람이었어요.

en.explanation: Temperature is very low.

examples.advanced: A cold attitude pushes people away.
examples.master: They seemed cold at first, but turned out to be a warm person.

examples.advanced: 따뜻한 말 한마디가 힘이 돼요.
examples.master: 따뜻한 마음을 가진 사람 곁에 있으면 행복해요.

en.explanation: Moderately high temperature. Heart is cozy.

examples.advanced: One warm word gives strength.
examples.master: Being next to someone with a warm heart makes you happy.

ko.explanation: 적당히 온도가 낮아 상쾌하다. 막힌 것이 뚫려 후련하다.

examples.advanced: 에어컨을 틀어서 시원해요.
examples.master: 문제가 해결되니까 마음이 시원해요.

en.explanation: Pleasantly cool temperature. Relief from something blocked.

examples.advanced: It's cool because the air conditioner is on.
examples.master: Now that the problem is solved, I feel relieved.

examples.advanced: 맛있는 음식을 먹으면 기분이 좋아져요.
examples.master: 맛있게 요리하는 비결은 사랑이에요.

en.explanation: The taste of food is good.

examples.intermediate: Food made by mom is the most delicious.
examples.advanced: When you eat delicious food, your mood improves.
examples.master: The secret to cooking delicious food is love.

examples.advanced: 맛없는 음식도 배고프면 맛있게 느껴져요.
examples.master: 맛없다고 말하기 전에 요리한 사람의 마음을 생각해요.

en.explanation: The taste of food is not good.

examples.intermediate: It's too salty, so it's not tasty.
examples.advanced: Even tasteless food tastes good when you're hungry.
examples.master: Before saying it's not tasty, think about the heart of the person who cooked it.

examples.advanced: 짠 음식을 많이 먹으면 건강에 안 좋아요.
examples.master: 한국 음식이 처음에는 짜게 느껴질 수 있어요.

en.explanation: The taste of salt is strong.

examples.intermediate: The food is a bit salty.
examples.advanced: Eating a lot of salty food is bad for health.
examples.master: Korean food might taste salty at first.

examples.advanced: 단 음식을 좋아하지만 건강을 위해 줄이고 있어요.
examples.master: 달콤한 말보다 진심 어린 말이 더 중요해요.

en.explanation: The taste of sugar is strong.

examples.advanced: I like sweet food, but I'm reducing it for health.
examples.master: Sincere words are more important than sweet words.

examples.advanced: 한국 음식은 매운 것이 많아요.
examples.master: 매운 음식을 먹으면 스트레스가 풀려요.

en.explanation: The taste of chili is strong. The tongue hurts.

examples.advanced: Korean food has a lot of spicy dishes.
examples.master: Eating spicy food relieves stress.

examples.advanced: 새콤한 맛이 입맛을 돋워요.
examples.master: 인생은 시고 달고 다양한 맛이 있어요.

en.explanation: A taste like vinegar or lemon.

examples.advanced: A sour taste stimulates the appetite.
examples.master: Life has various tastes—sour and sweet.

examples.advanced: 쓴 약이 병을 낫게 해요.
examples.master: 쓴 경험이 나중에 달콤한 결과를 가져와요.

en.explanation: A taste like medicine or bitter tea.

examples.advanced: Bitter medicine cures the illness.
examples.master: Bitter experiences bring sweet results later.

examples.advanced: 어려운 상황에서도 포기하지 마세요.
examples.master: 어려운 시기를 함께 이겨낸 친구가 진정한 친구예요.

en.explanation: Not easy to do. Hard to understand.

examples.advanced: Don't give up even in difficult situations.
examples.master: A friend who overcame difficult times together is a true friend.

examples.advanced: 쉬운 일을 꾸준히 하면 어려운 일도 쉬워져요.
examples.master: 쉽게 얻은 것은 쉽게 잃어버리기도 해요.

en.explanation: Not difficult to do. Simple to understand.

examples.intermediate: Cooking is easier than I thought.
examples.advanced: If you do easy things consistently, difficult things become easy too.
examples.master: What is easily obtained is also easily lost.

examples.advanced: 일이 재미있으면 시간이 빨리 가요.
examples.master: 재미있게 사는 것이 성공의 비결이에요.

en.explanation: Enjoyable and interesting.

examples.advanced: When work is fun, time passes quickly.
examples.master: Living interestingly is the secret to success.

examples.advanced: 재미없는 일도 의미를 찾으면 달라져요.
examples.master: 재미없다고 생각하면 모든 것이 재미없어져요.

en.explanation: Not enjoyable and dull.

examples.advanced: Even boring work changes when you find meaning in it.
examples.master: If you think it's boring, everything becomes boring.

examples.advanced: 바쁜 중에도 건강을 챙기세요.
examples.master: 바쁘게 사는 것과 의미 있게 사는 것은 달라요.

en.explanation: Having many things to do and no time.

examples.intermediate: I couldn't meet because I was too busy.
examples.advanced: Take care of your health even when you're busy.
examples.master: Living busily and living meaningfully are different things.

examples.advanced: 한가할 때 책을 읽어요.
examples.master: 한가한 시간을 잘 활용하면 자기 발전이 돼요.

en.explanation: Having nothing to do and being relaxed.

examples.advanced: I read books when I'm free.
examples.master: Using your free time well leads to self-development.

examples.advanced: 피곤할 때는 충분히 쉬어야 해요.
examples.master: 피곤한 몸보다 피곤한 마음이 더 힘들어요.

en.explanation: Body and mind are exhausted.

examples.intermediate: I'm tired because I have a lot of work.
examples.advanced: When you're tired, you should rest enough.
examples.master: A tired mind is harder than a tired body.

examples.advanced: 건강해야 행복하게 살 수 있어요.
examples.master: 건강은 잃어보면 그 소중함을 알게 돼요.

en.explanation: The body's condition is good. No illness.

examples.advanced: You can live happily when you're healthy.
examples.master: You realize the value of health when you lose it.

ko.explanation: 몸의 어느 부분이 고통스럽다. 마음이 슬프다.

examples.advanced: 아프면 일하지 말고 쉬세요.
examples.master: 사랑하는 사람이 아프면 마음이 더 아파요.

en.explanation: Some part of the body is in pain. The heart is sad.

examples.advanced: If you're sick, don't work and rest.
examples.master: When someone you love is sick, your heart hurts more.

examples.advanced: 작은 것에서 행복을 찾을 수 있어요.
examples.master: 행복은 목적지가 아니라 여행이에요.

en.explanation: Joyful and satisfied.

examples.intermediate: I'm happy because I'm with family.
examples.advanced: You can find happiness in small things.
examples.master: Happiness is not a destination but a journey.

examples.advanced: 슬플 때 울어도 괜찮아요.
examples.master: 슬픔을 나누면 반이 되고, 기쁨을 나누면 배가 돼요.

en.explanation: The heart hurts and wants to cry.

examples.advanced: It's okay to cry when you're sad.
examples.master: When you share sadness, it halves; when you share joy, it doubles.

examples.advanced: 기쁜 소식을 들으면 하루가 행복해요.
examples.master: 기쁜 일이 있으면 주변 사람들과 나누세요.

en.explanation: The heart is joyful and good.

examples.intermediate: I'm glad I passed the exam.
examples.advanced: When you hear good news, the whole day is happy.
examples.master: When you have something to be glad about, share it with people around you.

examples.advanced: 화가 날 때는 잠깐 쉬고 생각해요.
examples.master: 화를 내는 것보다 감정을 표현하는 방법을 배우세요.

en.explanation: The heart is displeased and irritated.

examples.intermediate: I get angry when I hear lies.
examples.advanced: When you're angry, take a break and think.
examples.master: Learn how to express emotions rather than getting angry.

examples.advanced: 무서운 것에 도전하면 성장해요.
examples.master: 무서움을 이기면 용기가 생겨요.

en.explanation: Fearful and scared.

examples.advanced: If you challenge scary things, you grow.
examples.master: When you overcome fear, courage is born.

examples.advanced: 외로울 때 친구에게 연락하세요.
examples.master: 외로움은 누구나 느끼는 자연스러운 감정이에요.

en.explanation: Feeling desolate because of being alone.

examples.intermediate: Living alone, I sometimes feel lonely.
examples.advanced: Contact friends when you feel lonely.
examples.master: Loneliness is a natural emotion that everyone feels.

examples.advanced: 친절한 사람 주변에는 친구가 많아요.
examples.master: 친절은 돈이 들지 않지만 가치가 있어요.

en.explanation: Being warm and helpful to others.

examples.advanced: Kind people have many friends around them.
examples.master: Kindness costs nothing but has value.

examples.advanced: 정직함은 신뢰의 기초예요.
examples.master: 정직하게 사는 것이 장기적으로 가장 현명해요.

en.explanation: Not telling lies and being truthful.

examples.advanced: Honesty is the foundation of trust.
examples.master: Living honestly is the wisest in the long run.

examples.advanced: 부지런한 사람은 시간을 잘 활용해요.
examples.master: 부지런함은 타고나는 것이 아니라 습관이에요.

en.explanation: Working hard and not being lazy.

examples.intermediate: If you work diligently, you succeed.
examples.advanced: Diligent people make good use of time.
examples.master: Diligence is not inborn but a habit.

examples.advanced: 게으른 습관을 고치고 싶어요.
examples.master: 게으름은 작은 결심부터 고칠 수 있어요.

en.explanation: Not wanting to work and not moving.

examples.intermediate: If you're lazy, it's hard to succeed.
examples.advanced: I want to fix my lazy habits.
examples.master: Laziness can be fixed starting with small resolutions.

examples.advanced: 조용한 곳에서 일하면 집중이 잘 돼요.
examples.master: 조용한 사람이 깊은 생각을 가지고 있을 수 있어요.

en.explanation: There is no sound or the sound is small.

examples.advanced: Working in a quiet place helps concentration.
examples.master: A quiet person may have deep thoughts.

examples.advanced: 시끄러운 환경에서는 집중하기 어려워요.
examples.master: 세상이 시끄러울수록 마음의 평화가 중요해요.

en.explanation: The sound is loud and unpleasant.

examples.advanced: It's hard to concentrate in a noisy environment.
examples.master: The noisier the world, the more important inner peace becomes.

examples.advanced: 깨끗한 환경이 건강에 좋아요.
examples.master: 마음을 깨끗하게 유지하는 것이 중요해요.

en.explanation: There is nothing dirty. Neat.

examples.advanced: A clean environment is good for health.
examples.master: It's important to keep your mind clean.

examples.advanced: 더러운 것을 만지면 손을 씻으세요.
examples.master: 겉은 깨끗해도 마음이 더러우면 안 돼요.

en.explanation: Not clean and messy.

examples.advanced: If you touch something dirty, wash your hands.
examples.master: It's not okay if the outside is clean but the heart is dirty.
